result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amy L. Koszarek

records.addlTxt: Warrant canceled with N.N. @ dispatch at 2:07 p.m.

No illegal use or possession of controlled substances. 
Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105.

1:26 PM/ RM 203. Defendant Amy L. Koszarek in court.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews case history and quashes warrant. Court had previously ordered bail bond forfeited pending a bail bond hearing. State requests Court quash warrant and order Def. to $1,000.00 signature bond with conditions of No illegal use or possession of controlled substances. Def. gives bail bond argument. Court orders $1,000.00 signature bond with conditions of No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. Court notes $250.00 previously posted bond to remain on hold status. Def. does wish to attain counsel. Def. waives time limits for P.H. Court accepts waiver of time limits.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Return on warrant on October 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

3:25 PM/ RM 301. Defendant Amy L. Koszarek not in court.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. State requests Court forfeit $250.00 bail bond previously posted, pending bail bond forfeiture hearing and requests a warrant in the amount of $1,000.00 or body active for Langlade/Adj. counties. Court orders $250.00 bail bond forfeited pending bail bond forfeiture hearing and authorizes a warrant in the amount of $1,000.00 or body for Langlade/ Adj. counties.
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.

11:31 AM Defendant Amy L. Koszarek appeared by video, in custody from Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom.  Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own, court appointed Atty. or represent self. Def. is going to reach out to Public Defender. State gives bail/bond recommendation and condition No illegal use or possession of controlled substances. Def. heard on bond and controlled substances. Court questions defendant on amount of bond.  Court orders $250 cash bond with No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
